[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Derive: Clone for Batch] [Payload sharing] When Batch is cloned, is BatchPayload properly deep-copied, or can multiple Batch instances reference the same transactions? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Derive: Clone for BatchRequest] [Request duplication] Can cloned BatchRequest instances be used to request the same batch multiple times, causing resource exhaustion on validators? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Derive: Clone for BatchResponse] [Response reuse] Can cloned BatchResponse instances be reused for different requests, causing validators to accept stale or manipulated batch data? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Derive: Clone for BatchMsg] [Message duplication] Can BatchMsg clones be sent multiple times to bypass rate limiting or max_num_batches restrictions? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Impl: Display for BatchRequest] [Information leak] Does the Display implementation expose sensitive information (like complete digest values) that could aid attackers in crafting forged requests? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Test: test_batch_payload_padding] [Incomplete coverage] Does the test only verify empty batch padding, missing edge cases like maximum-size batches, overflow conditions, or malformed transactions? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Test: test_batch_payload_padding] [Magic constant] The assertion uses hardcoded BATCH_PADDING_BYTES - can attackers exploit differences between test and production padding calculations? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::verify() num_bytes check] [Compression attack] Can an attacker provide highly compressible transactions that report small num_bytes but expand during processing, causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::new() with BatchPayload] [Size underflow] Can payload.num_bytes() underflow if transactions have negative or invalid sizes, bypassing size limits? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: PersistedValue::batch_info()] [Info tampering] Can the returned batch_info reference be used to modify internal state, or is it properly immutable? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::batch_info()] [Reference lifetime] Does batch_info() properly tie the reference lifetime to the Batch, preventing use-after-free when Batch is dropped? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: BatchMsg::verify() author validation] [Zero author] Can an attacker use PeerId::ZERO or invalid PeerId values that bypass epoch_authors validation? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: BatchRequest::verify() peer_id check] [Address collision] Can two different validators have colliding PeerId values, causing batch request authorization to be confused? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::verify() author equality] [Author mutation] If batch.author() can be modified after construction, can an attacker change the author after verify() passes? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::new() expiration parameter] [Zero expiration] Can batches with expiration=0 be created and accepted, causing immediate expiration and wasted consensus work? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: PersistedValue::summary() expiration handling] [Expiration wraparound] Can expiration_timestamp_secs() wrap around at u64::MAX, causing expired transactions to appear valid? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: PersistedValue::payload()] [Mutable return] Does payload() return an immutable reference, or can callers modify the payload vector, breaking batch integrity? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::into_transactions()] [Ownership transfer] When transactions are extracted, are they properly validated one more time, or can corrupted transactions be introduced? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Struct: PersistedValue fields] [Direct access] Are info and maybe_payload fields properly private, or can external code directly modify them bypassing validation? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Struct: Batch fields] [Field tampering] Are batch_info and payload fields protected from external modification, or can unsafe code or trait implementations mutate them? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Struct: BatchRequest fields] [Request forgery] Can epoch, source, or digest fields be modified after construction, allowing request forgery attacks? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Struct: BatchMsg fields] [Batches mutation] Can the internal batches Vec be modified between creation and verification, injecting unauthorized batches? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: Batch::verify()] [Error message leak] Do error messages from ensure! macros leak sensitive information about batch contents, validator state, or internal system configuration? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: BatchRequest::verify()] [Error handling bypass] Can error paths in verify() be exploited to bypass authentication checks through exception handling manipulation? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/types.rs] [Function: BatchMsg::verify()] [Partial validation] If verify() fails midway through batch iteration, are earlier validated batches still accepted, causing partial consensus state updates? (High)
